However, the evidence suggests that these "second-generation" rent control policies still tend to reduce overall housing production (Diamond et al., 2019).

So while rent control aims to improve affordability for existing tenants, it often ends up reducing the supply of new housing and worsening affordability for non-protected renters over time.
